snippet: Greta Hawkins, principal of a Brooklyn elementary school, has been excoriated over replacing Lee Greenwood’s “God Bless the U.S.A.” in an end-of-year ceremony, but her critics are overlooking the facts.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column deplores attacks from political groups, teachers and some parent against Greta Hawkins, principal of Public School 90 in Brooklyn; charges that criticism over Hawkins's decision to replace song God Bless the USA in an end-of-year kindergarten ceremony overlooks the facts and suggests something deeply dispiriting about New Yorkers' ability to resolve differences.
lead_paragraph: Greta Hawkins, principal of a Brooklyn elementary school, has been excoriated over replacing Lee Greenwood’s “God Bless the U.S.A.” in an end-of-year ceremony, but her critics are overlooking the facts.

headline.print_headline: Principal Is Trampled In a Rush to Vilify
